column4: Hello. I am building a TeamSpeak 3 Server on 10.04. I am trying to figure out how to have my server automatically execute a file on startup. If I need to restart my server, I don't want to go into the console to enter the startup command every time I do. The exact file is in this location: /home/ts3user/teamspeak3-server_linux-amd64/ts3server_minimal_runscript.sh
I would imply that you use a cron job to execute a script at startup. But technically I'm not familiar with the cron command.
You could open a terminal and type: man cron
